fileheader.filedesc: Functions to access POL system data.

function.name: ReloadConfiguration
function.explain: reloads pol.cfg (most entries), npcdesc.cfg and bannedips.cfg
Linux: HUP signal will cause ReloadConfiguration to be called.

function.name: Packages
function.explain: Get an array of "package objects", with "name", "supports_http" and "npcdesc" members. (more info TBD)

function.name: ReadMillisecondClock
function.explain: Returns a double of the current millisecond clock. The precision is 10ms.

function.name: SetSysTrayPopupText

parameter.name: text
parameter.value: String tooltip text for systray icon

function.explain: Sets the systray icon's tooltip text (win32 only)

function.name: GetItemDescriptor
function.explain: Returns a struct of all itemdesc.cfg properties for the objtype.

The keys are the property names, i.e. "Color", "Desc", etc. The values can be String, Integer, Real. The exceptions are "CProps" and "StackingIgnoresCProps". "CProps" is a dictionary where the CProp name is the key, and the value can be any packable type (i.e. array, struct, etc.). "StackingIgnoresCProps" is an array of strings.
Note: Descriptor of Weapon will return MinDamage and MaxDamage calculated from Damage-Dice too.

The primary use of this function is to pass it to any of the item creation functions, and the values in the struct will be used in place of the static itemdesc.cfg values. Use it to assign specific properties to an item during creation, rather than after. This allows easier stacking with existing item stacks.
function.return: A struct of all itemdesc.cfg properties and values.
function.error: "Itemdesc.cfg entry for objtype X not found."

function.name: FormatItemDescription
function.explain: This formats the desc using Pols built in Singular/Plular formatter.

function.name: Realms
function.explain: Returns a dictionary of structs or a single struct.
If a single case-sensitive realm name is passed, will return the information for only that realm.
example: "realm_name" -> "width" "height" "mapid" "toplevel_item_count" "mobile_count" "season"
function.return: A dictionary of structs of Realms or struct of single Realm

function.name: GetCmdLevelName
function.explain: Will get a command level's name.

function.name: GetCmdLevelNumber
function.explain: Will get the numeric value of a command level.
function.error: "Could not find a command level with that name."

function.name: IncRevision
function.explain: Increases the internal "Revision" number of an UObject. Used to manually increase this number for scripted changes to things such as mob.race and such where core does not auto increase it.

function.name: ListenPoints
function.explain: Array of listen points...

function.name: ListTextCommands
function.explain: Returns a dict of a dict of structs.
Dict 1 - Package names; Dict 2 - Command levels; Struct - .dir .script
function.return: Dict of a dict of structs

function.name: GetPackageByName
function.explain: Will return a package reference.

function.name: CreatePacket
function.explain: Creates a new packet object. Type is the byte command id that always is set as the first byte (no need to set it yourself). Size is the fixed-length size for this packet, or MSGLEN_VARIABLE if it is variable length (no need to figure out the size in advance, the packet buffer will be resized as need by using the Set* methods).

Notes: polsys.em constants for this function:
const MSGLEN_VARIABLE := -1;
function.return: A new packet object or Error

function.name: AddRealm

parameter.name: realm_name
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

parameter.name: base_realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Creates a new Realm based on an other realm, uses same map and regions.

function.name: DeleteRealm

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Deletes a ShadowRealm, only if the realm is "clean"

function.name: GetRealmDecay

parameter.name: realm_name
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Returns whether realm has decay or enabled or not.

function.name: SetRealmDecay

parameter.name: realm_name
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

parameter.name: has_decay
parameter.value: Boolean - whether decay should be enabled or not

function.explain: Enables or disables decay for realm.

function.name: MD5Encrypt
function.explain: Encrypts given string.

function.name: LogCPropProfile
function.explain: Writes the CProp profiling info into cpprofile.log file (see ProfileCProps option in pol.cfg).
